message.content:
cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.GT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a foundational problem in boolean functions, which is a topic in theoretical computer science. The use of a communication game to attack the sensitivity conjecture suggests a connection to computational complexity theory (cs.CC) and information theory (cs.IT). The consideration of natural variants of the problem and the presentation of protocols suggest a connection to algorithms and data structures (cs.DS) and game theory (cs.GT). The analysis of the upper bound on the cost of the game suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG).
